hive_lesson.title: 1432 Going to Mars
hive_lesson.description: Reasons to go or not go to space

hive_text_custom.text: : So do you think we should sent people to Mars or Moon to spend all this money on space travel?
: Well, I think we should. Space travel can give people hope for the future, and space travel can unite people from different countries for a common goal.
: But do any countries work together to travel in space?

: Oh certainly. The International Space station has astronauts from different countries working together. And I think that a joint effort is the best way to do space missions. I think that we could go back to the Moon and learn much more by going there than we can learn if we don't go there.

, but I think we could learn more and we could improve more if we can help the people on Earth. Think of everything we could learn from the children that can't get an education these days. Maybe the next Einstein is a poor little girl who doesn't have the money to go to school. If we spent more money on school or clean water and
, maybe we could learn more from ourselves than from going to space and going to Mars.

I think that it would be nice if we could have all the rich countries spend money on education for poor people, but if you look at the numbers, the cost of one space mission is much cheaper than the things we spend money on now.

hive_text_custom.text: , is nice way to say you understand a person's opinion, even though you might disagree with it. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
This test is too hard. Tests should be easy.
 I see what you mean.

hive_text_custom.text: We need clean water and vaccines.
A vaccine is medicine that protects people from illness or disease. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The children got a vaccine for the flu.
 We need a vaccine for malaria.

hive_text_custom.text: What comes to mind is war.
When something comes to mind, you think about it for a moment. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
When you think of summer, what comes to mind?
 A good cafe? Nothing comes to mind. Sorry!

hive_text_custom.text: But war goes on and on for days and days.
When something goes on and on for a long period of time, it does not stop, even though people want it to stop. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
My friend can talk on and on for hours.
 The meeting just went on and on.

hive_text_custom.text: We could get rid of a terrible disease.
When you get rid of something, you remove it from your life. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
She finally got rid of her boyfriend.
 We need to get rid of these old books.

hive_text_custom.text: We'll have to agree to disagree.
The phrase, agree to disagree, is a nice way to end a conversation when two people will not agree with each other. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I do not think so. Let's just agree to disagree.
 They agreed to disagree and changed the topic.
